content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool and creative question! With a twist and not "so-forward" solution makes it a fun clash to play with.

Great one! I'm already wanting to approve it.
Except for one thing: Your example test case didn't have any overhangs, which may lead to confusion when doing fastest. (Having no time to look through the test cases not directly on the question.) So I suggest also adding an example, like the second input to the @Goal part?

This question is really interesting, by the way.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I love that one, very creative.
I would've loved to discover it in real conditions !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very Nice. Can see you put hard work into the tests and validators, straightforward solution. Suitable for all modes
Small note: I think it's better to mention that raindrops do not collapse.
Thank you for your feedback! I get what you mean, but I think there might be a better way to describe it than them not collapsing. Maybe I can say "how many *individual* raindrops hit the ground"?
Thanks for your suggestion! I've changed the sample testcase to have an overhang, let me know if that is more suitable. And by all means, feel free to approve it—the suspense is killing me!
